name: UnitySetupTask
description: Azure Pipelines task to setup Unity editors and modules on the build machine.
helpMarkDown: Use this task to install Unity editors and modules required to build your project on the build agent. [More Information](https://unitydevops.com/docs/unity-setup-task).
author: Dinomite

inputs.name: versionSelectionMode
inputs.label: Unity version to install
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select which Unity version to install. You can either use the project's version or specify a version yourself.

inputs.name: unityProjectPath
inputs.label: Unity project path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter the path to the Unity project within the repository. If no value is entered, the root of the repository will be used.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Unity editor version to install, e.g. value: `2022.2.1f1`.

inputs.name: revision
inputs.label: Revision
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Unity editor version revision to install, e.g. value: `c7b5465681fb`.

inputs.name: username
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The username used to activate the Unity Editor.

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password used to activate the Unity Editor.

inputs.name: serial
inputs.label: Serial
inputs.helpMarkDown: Serial key used to activate the Unity Editor. The serial key must be assigned to the user defined by username and password above.

inputs.name: deactivateSeatOnComplete
inputs.label: Deactivate seat on complete
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default the seat activation is released again after the pipeline has run. Uncheck this to keep the activation active.

inputs.name: unityHubExecutableLocation
inputs.label: Unity Hub executable location
inputs.helpMarkDown: The task needs the Unity Hub executable to perform CLI commands. If your Unity Hub is not in the default install location, use this option to specify its location.

inputs.name: customUnityHubExecutableLocation
inputs.label: Custom Unity Hub executable path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Specify where to look for the Unity Hub executable on the agent.

inputs.name: macOSArchitecture
inputs.label: Editor Architecture (macOS only!)
inputs.helpMarkDown: macOS only: Use this argument to explicitly choose between the Apple Silicon or Intel version of the Unity Editor. Defaults to Intel, x86_64.

inputs.name: installAndroidModule
inputs.label: Android Build Support
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the Android build module.

inputs.name: installAndroidChildModules
inputs.label: Install Android SDK & NDK Tools & OpenJDK
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Installs Android SDK & NDK Tools as well as the OpenJDK module.

inputs.name: configureAndroidTooling
inputs.label: Configure editor Android tools paths
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Configures Android SDK, NDK, OpenJDK and Gradle path settings on the installed editor prior to building.

inputs.name: installIOSModule
inputs.label: iOS Build Support
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the iOS build module.

inputs.name: installTVOSModule
inputs.label: tvOS Build Support
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the tvOS build module.

inputs.name: installVisionOSModule
inputs.label: visionOS Build Support
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the visionOS build module.

inputs.name: installLinuxMonoModule
inputs.label: Linux Build Support (Mono)
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the visionOS build module.

inputs.name: installLinuxIL2CPPModule
inputs.label: Linux Build Support (IL2CPP)
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the visionOS build module.

inputs.name: installMacMonoModule
inputs.label: Mac Build Support (Mono)
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the Mac (Mono) build module.

inputs.name: installMacIL2CPPModule
inputs.label: Mac Build Support (IL2CPP)
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the Mac (IL2CPP) build module.

inputs.name: installWindowsIL2CPPModule
inputs.label: Windows Build Support (IL2CPP)
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the Windows (IL2CPP) build module.

inputs.name: installUWPModule
inputs.label: Universal Windows Platform Build Support
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the UWP build module.

inputs.name: installWebGLModule
inputs.label: WebGL Build Support
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Install the WebGL build module.

outputVariables.name: logsOutputPath
outputVariables.description: Path to the Unity editor log files generated.
